County of Marin EMS
April 2025 C 4
BRADYCARDIA
Indications
HR <50 with adequate or inadequate perfusion
Unstable?
No Yes
Signs of poor perfusion:
• Decreased LOC
• SBP <100
• CP, CHF, SOB
ALS RMC ALS RMC
• Atropine 1mg IV/IO
• Repeat q3-5 min to total of 3mg
• NS fluid bolus of 250-500ml IV/IO if
hypotensive and lungs clear
• Repeat as needed
• Do not delay pacing for patients with
inadequate perfusion
If inadequate perfusion
External cardiac pacing, ALS PR 11
Critical Information If SBP <90
• Push-dose Epinephrine
Treatment of hypotension with
• Mix 1ml Epinephrine (0.1mg/ml concentration)
Push-dose Epinephrine should
with 9ml NS in a 10ml syringe
take precedence over use of
• Administer Push-dose Epinephrine 1ml IV/IO
atropine for treatment of
• Repeat every 3-5 min
bradycardia during ROSC
• Titrate to maintain SBP >90
• Monitor BP every 5 minutes
